presentation.fsa
Class ReflexiveEdge.ReflexiveLayout

java.lang.Object
  presentation.GraphicalLayout
      presentation.fsa.BezierLayout
          presentation.fsa.ReflexiveEdge.ReflexiveLayout
Enclosing class:
ReflexiveEdge
public class ReflexiveEdge.ReflexiveLayout
extends BezierLayout

Same data as BezierLayout (control points and label offset vector) but different algorithms and handlers specific to rendering a self-loop.

Author:
Helen Bretzke

Field Detail

minAxisLength

private float minAxisLength
The minimum length of the axis vector from the centre of the node to the midpoint of this edge. FIXME the axis doesn't reach the *computed* midpoint.

getMidpoint

public java.awt.geom.Point2D getMidpoint()
Returns:
the midpoint of the curve.

initializeShape

public void initializeShape()
FIXME Problem: using fixed scalars and angles causes midpoint of computed curve to drift away from midpoint set by user. If the curve has already been loaded from a file, compute the correct axis, angles and scalars to correctly reproduce the curve.

getVisibleCurve

public java.awt.geom.CubicCurve2D getVisibleCurve()
Description copied from class: BezierLayout
Returns the visible portion of the curve i.e. the part that is outside the boundaries of both source and target nodes; null if no such segment exists.

Overrides:
getVisibleCurve in class BezierLayout
Returns:
the portion of the curve that is external to the node, null if no such segment exists

computeCurve

public void computeCurve()
Computes a symmetric reflexive bezier curve based on location of node, and angle of tangent vectors (to bezier curve) from centre axis vector.

Overrides:
computeCurve in class BezierLayout

setPoint

public void setPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D point,
                     int index)
Set the midpoint for a symmetric, reflexive bezier edge. Constraint: if midpoint is inside node, set to minimum distance from node border.

Overrides:
setPoint in class BezierLayout
